title: Highest Cereal Yield
description: In 2022, Saint Vincent and the Grenadines achieved a cereal yield of 31,620.7 kg per hectare, one of the highest in the world.

title: Lowest Short-term Debt Exposure
description: As of 2023, the country's short-term debt was only 0.0001% of its total external debt, showcasing minimal exposure.

title: Minimal Air Pollution Exposure
description: In 2015, only a negligible percentage of the population was exposed to PM2.5 pollution levels exceeding WHO targets.

title: Low Methane Emissions from Transport
description: The country's methane emissions from transport were just 0.0001 Mt CO2e in 2023, among the lowest globally.

title: Low Suicide Mortality Rate
description: In 2021, the suicide mortality rate was 0.41 per 100,000 population, indicating a relatively low incidence.

title: Strong Net Barter Terms of Trade
description: The net barter terms of trade index stood at 185.83 in 2021, reflecting favorable trade conditions.

title: Minimal Industrial Freshwater Withdrawals
description: In 2021, industrial freshwater withdrawals accounted for only 0.0235% of total freshwater withdrawal, highlighting efficient water use.

title: Low External Debt Stocks
description: The external debt stocks were just $905 in 2023, indicating a strong financial position with minimal debt burden.

title: Minimal Nitrous Oxide Emissions from Transport
description: In 2023, nitrous oxide emissions from transport were only 0.0003 Mt CO2e, demonstrating low environmental impact.

title: Low Grants and Other Revenue
description: In 2017, grants and other revenue were valued at 68,920,000 LCU, indicating limited external financial support.

title: Minimal Need for International Protection
description: In 2021, only 5 individuals were in need of international protection, reflecting a stable socio-political environment.
